resources.string: VirtualXposed
Opening app...
Save successful!
The Xposed module will not take effect until you enable it in XposedInstaller\'s module setting.
VirtualXposed is an app that provides the ability to use the Xposed module without needing root access, unlocking the bootloader, or modifying the system image.
QQ Group (Click to copy group number)
WeChat Group (Click to copy)
Reboot successfully!
Reboot successfully!
Reboot successfully!
In Meizu OS, You can only use VirtualXposed by cloning an app; please install XposedInstaller first.
Don\'t donate to me if you aren\'t rich :)
Creating shortcut successful!

Thanks Cheney for providing the awesome icon, and thank you Pei, Peggy, and too many others to list, for your hard work. Thanks for the ideas and suggestions you all provided. Special thanks to YingLin for taking the time to help me achieve my design :)
Please allow VirtualXposed to run in the background, otherwise you may not receive notifications from some virtual apps.
Installing %1$s ...
This will kill all apps currently running in VirtualXposed. Reboot anyway?
Latest version is installed
You have chosen an existing app. Do you want to install it as a separate app, or just update the existing one? \n (Installed version %1$s, selected version: %2$s )
Installation complete
You have chosen an existing app, \n (Installed version %1$s, selected version: %2$s ), install it?
Please add both the app and the Xposed module to VirtualXposed first, otherwise the Xposed module won\'t take effect.
If you can enter settings by the menu key on main activity, you can hide this, otherwise you may not be able to enter settings! \n (Restart VirtualXposed to take effect.)
Go back to system launcher instead of the virtual launcher when in a virtual app. (Restart VirtualXposed to take effect.)
Open this for a trade-off between stability and compatibility
Official website

Please specify your phone model, Android version, Xposed plugin, and version of the corresponding app, and then describe (in as much detail as possible) the problem you are experiencing, otherwise it is considered invalid feedback (because we can\'t effectively troubleshoot and fix said problem with only \"this app crashes\" ;) )
Disable the resident notification of VirtualXposed. (When disabled, VirtualXposed may be killed by system frequently. Please be cautious!)
Enable/Disable Xposed module (You must enable it manually for it to take effect)
